title: Azir main in the making
body: From my starting point of a mediocre midlander by bronze5 standards, how many normals would it take before I am at a gold level proficiency of azir, so I can climb to gold, and then do the same thing for the home stretch to diamond 1?

replies.body:
You need to learn more than just azir.

Learn champions power spikes and when you can should and shouldn't be aggressive 

Learn CDs of big abilities (or core abilities of a champs damage source and cc source)
Learn the and start saying CDs of flash heal exhaust ignite teleport etc

Learn how to properly build and build orders (gold efficient)

Learn to trade in lane without losing farm
Be at 90cs @ 10 mins minimum 

Learn to disengage

Learn how to play the map not jut the champion 

Etc etc etc.

It all depends on your ability. When nightblue3 started out he was bronze 5 in his first seasons end then he practiced like a mad man and got to challenger the next season.

It's possible but not easy

Learn to depend on yourself and recognise your win conditions

this isnt helpful even in the slightest. i didnt ask how to play league at a gold level.
i asked for a time frame on how long it would take for me to learn the MECHANICS of azir.

> gold level proficiency of azir, so I can climb to gold, and then do the same thing for the home stretch to diamond 1?

you want to climb, its not just mechanics that you will need.

------

now putting all that aside, a gold level Azir? honestly around 100games to be mechanical sound and that i would say is the skill floor, what you can do after being sound is the difference maker =, the use of your wall, where and how positioned, how you use your shuffle, etc.

to get to gold with just Azir? i think it shouldn't be that hard if you have the time that is of course as he doesn't have a lamer-counter really and is still a fantastic champion even after the nerfs, play safe, out poke, out scale, just remember above all he is  a scalling mage so get your spike asap to truly impact the game.
